page.shortlink: ux list detail view on synchronize server side
page.description: The name of an Xbasic function to call when the data is synchronized.

section.important: Only applies to the top-most (parent) List control in a hierarchy of linked Lists with pre-fetched data.

description.p: Called when the user synchronizes a List with a Detail view. This event is called before Alpha Anywhere does any work on the server to process the edited data.

If you want to take complete control of the synchronization process and handle it yourself, you can create an Xbasic function to handle the event that will be called when the *[ui:On synchronize]* event occurs.
The function will take an argument, *[xb:e]*, which has a number of properties:

argument.name: e
argument.description: The e object that is passed in to the Xbasic function. The e object has the following properties:

property.name: rtc
property.description: Object that includes many run-time calculation properties, including arguments

property.name: listData
property.description: An array of objects. Each item in the array contains the data for the dirty records in the List. If the List has child Lists, the dirty child Lists are nested in the array

property.name: listDataJSON
property.description: The raw List data (in JSON format) that was submitted from the client (this is the data that is parsed into the e.listData object)

property.name: handled
property.description: Indiciates if synchronization was handled. The function *[MUST]* set *[xb:e.handled]* to .t. or .f..

property.name: javascript
property.description: Optional JavaScript to execute in the client.

section.description: If the *[ui:On synchronize]* Xbasic function handles the synchronization, it must set the *[xb:e.handled]* property to .t. to indicate to Alpha Anywhere that synchronization has been handled and no further processing is needed. Alpha Anywhere will synchronize the data if *[xb:e.handled]* is set to .f..

section.title: Synchronizing All Records in a Hierarchical List Structure
section.description: When synchronizing a List that is part of a parent-child hierarchy, all of the Lists in the hierarchy are synchronized. Only new and modified records in the parent and child Lists will be sent to the server. You can optionally submit all child records to the server (including child records that were not edited). Submitting all records is accomplished using the client-side event used to synchronize the data. This event uses the .saveListEdits() method.
